name: Visual Studio Code
description: Popular lightweight code editor with extensions, debugging, and Git support.

name: Atom
description: Open-source hackable text editor (now archived but still widely referenced).

name: Sublime Text
description: Fast, minimal, and powerful text editor for developers.

name: Vim
description: Highly configurable terminal-based text editor for power users.

name: Neovim
description: Modern fork of Vim with better plugins and performance.

name: Notepad++
description: Free Windows text and source code editor.

name: Brackets
description: Open-source code editor focused on web development.

name: WebStorm
description: Professional JavaScript IDE with smart coding assistance.

name: PyCharm
description: Python IDE with advanced debugging and testing tools.

name: IntelliJ IDEA
description: Powerful Java and multi-language IDE.

name: Eclipse
description: Open-source IDE for Java, C/C++, and more.

name: NetBeans
description: Apache IDE for Java, PHP, and web apps.

name: Kate
description: Advanced text editor for Linux and cross-platform users.

name: Geany
description: Lightweight IDE with built-in terminal and plugins.

name: Micro
description: Modern terminal-based editor with mouse support.

name: Lite XL
description: Lightweight, extensible code editor written in Lua.

name: Zed
description: High-performance collaborative code editor.

name: Code::Blocks

name: Emacs
description: Extensible, customizable text editor and development environment.
